CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In summary , a novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was successfully obtained , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the conjugated polymer. It is a single material entity in this paragraph.
2. Benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene: This is the name of the donor unit in the main chain of the conjugated polymer.
3. Diketopyrrolopyrrole: This is the name of the acceptor unit in the side chain of the conjugated polymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the conjugated polymer.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In summary , a novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was successfully obtained , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the novel conjugated polymer. It consists of three parts: PBDT (benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene), TDPP (diketopyrrolopyrrole), and S (possibly a suffix indicating the presence of a side chain).

2. benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene: This is the name of the donor unit in the main chain of the polymer.

3. diketopyrrolopyrrole: This is the name of the acceptor unit in the side chain of the polymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

The novel conjugated polymer, PBDT-TDPP-S, contains the following material properties:

1. Donor unit: benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene
2. Acceptor unit: diketopyrrolopyrrole

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene (donor unit in main chain) |
| diketopyrrolopyrrole (acceptor unit in side chain) |
| PBDT-TDPP-S (novel conjugated polymer) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In summary , a novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was successfully obtained , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the novel conjugated polymer. It can be considered as a single property value entity, representing the specific type of polymer that was obtained.
2. benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene: This is the name of the donor unit in the main chain of the polymer.
3. in main chain: This phrase describes the location of the benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene unit in the polymer.
4. acceptor unit: This is a general term for the unit that acts as an electron acceptor in the polymer.
5. diketopyrrolopyrrole: This is the name of the acceptor unit in the side chain of the polymer.
6. in side chain: This phrase describes the location of the diketopyrrolopyrrole unit in the polymer.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the novel conjugated polymer.
2. benzo [1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene: This is the name of the donor unit in the main chain of the polymer, which is a material property relevant to the electronic structure and optoelectronic properties of the polymer.
3. diketopyrrolopyrrole: This is the name of the acceptor unit in the side chain of the polymer, which is a material property relevant to the electronic structure and optoelectronic properties of the polymer.
